thread.title: Prince Harry's visit to the North East
thread.title_full: Prince Harry's visit to the North East | Tyne Tees - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Prince Harry's visit to the North East
text:
Prince Harry is to visit the North East today. His Royal Highness is coming to the region to meet volunteers and ex-servicemen as part of his charity work for Walking With the Wounded.
He will also promote his Heads Together campaign, which aims to get people talking about mental health.
Prince Harry last visited the region in 2015 when he made a visit to Northumberland Wildlife Trust and a Byker armed forces charity. Credit: ITV News The first stop on his tour of the North East will see Prince Harry learn how Walking With the Wounded is working with the local council and police in Gateshead on projects to support ex-servicemen.
The organisation's focus is on providing specialist support for mental health.
Prince Harry will join a training session in the centre of Newcastle with Team Heads Together as part of an ongoing campaign Credit: ITV News As the countdown to the London Marathon continues, Prince Harry will also meet runners and Heads Together supporters from across the region who are working to make 2017 the mental health marathon.
He'll be joined Tyneside Olympic legends Steve Cram and Jonathan Edwards in training session on Newcastle Quayside.
Heads Together, the campaign to change the conversation on mental health which is spearheaded by Their Royal Highnesses, is the Official Charity for the 2017 Virgin Money London Marathon.
Prince Harry's final calling point will be to visit the Heads Together charity day at Virgin Money HQ, to hear from staff and supporters.
People are lining the streets to greet Prince Harry Credit: ITV Kensington Palace @KensingtonRoyal Follow Prince Harry will join Steve Cram @ jarrowarrow & Jonathan Edwards @ jde66 @ heads_together training day in Newcastleâ€¦ https://t.co/N0mDDDudl2
